org.apache.juneau.jsonschema

Class JsonSchemaGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Context
      • org.apache.juneau.BeanContext
        • org.apache.juneau.BeanTraverseContext
          • org.apache.juneau.jsonschema.JsonSchemaGenerator

  • @ConfigurableContext
public class JsonSchemaGenerator
extends BeanTraverseContext
    Generates JSON-schema metadata about POJOs.

    • Field Detail

      • JSONSCHEMA_addDescriptionsTo

        public static final String JSONSCHEMA_addDescriptionsTo
        Configuration property: Add descriptions to types.
        Property:
        • Name: "JsonSchemaGenerator.addDescriptionsTo.s"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: Empty string.
        • Session property: false
        • Methods:
          • JsonSchemaGeneratorBuilder.addDescriptionsTo(String)
        Description:

        Identifies which categories of types that descriptions should be automatically added to generated schemas.

        The description is the result of calling ClassMeta.getFullName().

        The format is a comma-delimited list of any of the following values:

        • BEAN
        • COLLECTION
        • ARRAY
        • MAP
        • STRING
        • NUMBER
        • BOOLEAN
        • ANY
        • OTHER
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JSONSCHEMA_addExamplesTo

        public static final String JSONSCHEMA_addExamplesTo
        Configuration property: Add examples.
        Property:
        • Name: "JsonSchemaGenerator.addExamplesTo.s"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: Empty string.
        • Session property: false
        • Methods:
          • JsonSchemaGeneratorBuilder.addExamplesTo(String)
        Description:

        Identifies which categories of types that examples should be automatically added to generated schemas.

        The examples come from calling ClassMeta.getExample(BeanSession) which in turn gets examples from the following:

        • Example
        • BeanContext.BEAN_examples

        The format is a comma-delimited list of any of the following values:

        • BEAN
        • COLLECTION
        • ARRAY
        • MAP
        • STRING
        • NUMBER
        • BOOLEAN
        • ANY
        • OTHER
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JSONSCHEMA_allowNestedDescriptions

        public static final String JSONSCHEMA_allowNestedDescriptions
        Configuration property: Allow nested descriptions.
        Property:

        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        • Session property: false
        • Methods:
          • JsonSchemaGeneratorBuilder.allowNestedDescriptions()
        Description:

        Identifies whether nested descriptions are allowed in schema definitions.

        See Also:

        Constant Field Values

      • JSONSCHEMA_beanDefMapper

        public static final String JSONSCHEMA_beanDefMapper
        Configuration property: Bean schema definition mapper.
        Property:
        • Name: "JsonSchemaGenerator.beanDefMapper.o"
        • Data type: BeanDefMapper
        • Default: BasicBeanDefMapper
        • Session property: false
        • Methods:
          • JsonSchemaGeneratorBuilder.beanDefMapper(Class)
          • JsonSchemaGeneratorBuilder.beanDefMapper(BeanDefMapper)
        Description:

        Interface to use for converting Bean classes to definition IDs and URIs.

        Used primarily for defining common definition sections for beans in Swagger JSON.

        This setting is ignored if JSONSCHEMA_useBeanDefs is not enabled.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JSONSCHEMA_defaultSchemas

        public static final String JSONSCHEMA_defaultSchemas
        Configuration property: Default schemas.
        Property:
        • Name: "JsonSchemaGenerator.defaultSchema.smo"
        • Data type: Map<String,ObjectMap>
        • Default: Empty map.
        • Session property: false
        • Methods:
          • JsonSchemaGeneratorBuilder.defaultSchema(Class,ObjectMap)
        Description:

        Allows you to override or provide custom schema information for particular class types.

        Keys are full class names.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JSONSCHEMA_ignoreTypes

        public static final String JSONSCHEMA_ignoreTypes
        Configuration property: Ignore types from schema definitions.
        Property:
        • Name: "JsonSchemaGenerator.ignoreTypes.s"
        • Data type: String (comma-delimited)
        • Default: null.
        • Session property: false
        Description:

        Defines class name patterns that should be ignored when generating schema definitions in the generated Swagger documentation.

        Example:

        // Don't generate schema for any prototype packages or the class named 'Swagger'. @RestResource( properties={ @Property(name=JSONSCHEMA_ignoreTypes, value="Swagger,*.proto.*") } public class MyResource {...}

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JSONSCHEMA_useBeanDefs

        public static final String JSONSCHEMA_useBeanDefs
        Configuration property: Use bean definitions.
        Property:
        • Name: "JsonSchemaGenerator.useBeanDefs.b"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        • Methods:
          • JsonSchemaGeneratorBuilder.useBeanDefs()
        Description:

        When enabled, schemas on beans will be serialized as the following:

        { type: 'object', '$ref': '#/definitions/TypeId' }

        The definitions can then be retrieved from the session using JsonSchemaGeneratorSession.getBeanDefs().

        Definitions can also be added programmatically using JsonSchemaGeneratorSession.addBeanDef(String, ObjectMap).

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT

        public static final JsonSchemaGenerator DEFAULT
        Default serializer, all default settings.

      • isUseBeanDefs

        protected final boolean isUseBeanDefs()

        Returns:

        See Also:
        JSONSCHEMA_useBeanDefs

      • isIgnoredType

        public boolean isIgnoredType(ClassMeta<?> cm)
        Returns true if the specified type is ignored.

        The type is ignored if it's specified in the JSONSCHEMA_ignoreTypes setting.
        Ignored types return null on the call to JsonSchemaGeneratorSession.getSchema(ClassMeta).

        Parameters:
        cm - The type to check.
        Returns:
        true if the specified type is ignored.

        Returns:
        A new map containing the properties defined on this context.
